root: ^You wake in a familiar cabin. Right back where you started.
^A nauseating cackle echoes in your head, sending shudders down your spine. Its mocking presence lingers in your mind.
^You knew the risks, of course. But what self-respecting wizard would miss the chance to experiment with the essence of a god?
^Just days ago you were chasing after a champion of the god of trickery that decided to mess with your home.

b: ^ Your home is your playground after all.
^ You'd rather have peace in the region after all.

root: ^Eventually you caught up to the troublemaker, and despite their divine backing you managed to eke out a victory.

b: ^ Not wanting to miss the chance of learning the tricks of used by a champion, you got to experimenting.
^ Wanting to avoid incidents like this in the future, you decided to experiment with the now-dead champion's source of power.

root: ^Perhaps unsurprisingly, the backer of said champion wasn't exactly a fan of your antics.
^So, it played a trick on you.
^"Have fun sorting this mess out!" it said amidst a cackling laugh, its
^"But worry not, your precious book can still be restored", it said, with a mischievous smile creeping in your mind.
^"You see, I enjoy a good card game! Gather your deck and meet me back at the peak of this mountain."
^"If you manage to be entertaining enough, I'll even consider putting your little spellbook back to how it was!"
^"But for now, I think I'll help you out just a little, to make sure you don't go dying on the way back to your little cabin."

b: ^ little hat! Though I'm not exactly sure how a hat sleeps.

root: ^And so you ended up back here.
^As you try to gather your bearings, you check your pockets to find a few... playing cards?
^Your keys were nowhere to be found, however.
^ you decide to try out the cards you found.

s: ^You eat the apple. It has a nice crunch to it.
^A roaring bonfire springs forth right beneath your feet!
^You have a lovely conversation with yourself.

b: ^ You even add some spice, speaking half of your lines through the crease on your front-side, and half through the mouth on your host body.

s: ^You ponder the lockpick. It doesn't seem to do anything when used on yourself.
^You heft the frying pan in your hand. It has a comforting weight to it.
^You spin the dagger in your hand, and decide on a round of five-finger-fillet.
^The staff feels comfortable in your hand, but nothing useful happens.
^You consider the potion in your hand.
^You adjust the apple in your hand for a better grip before flinging it wildly at the door!
^A roaring bonfire springs forth next to the door, quickly setting it ablaze!
^You attempt to chat with the door. It does not reply. Still, you've had worse conversations.
^You take out a lockpick, and attempt to pick the door open.
^You heft the frying pan in your hand, determined to pop the handle straight off the door, and the lock with it.
^You give your dagger a quick spin before unleashing a flurry of strikes at the door!
^You heft the staff in your hand, determined to pop the handle straight off the door, and the lock with it.
^You adjust the bottle for a better grip, and launch it at the door!

c-1: ^You hop away just quickly enough to avoid being burned. That was close.

b: ^For a moment you consider smashing your head in, but refrain this time.
^ test the durability of your host body
^ with the frying pan proves too much, and you smash it on your head with surprising force!

s0: ^ As your pace quickens, you eventually fumble and stab your finger.
s1: ^ You quicken your pace as you go, but even after a good 30 seconds of intense finger-filleting, you haven't yet hit yourself.

b: ^Using it now would be a waste, perhaps its better to save it for later.
^You down the potion, and feel its healing properties take effect.

c-8: ^It makes a loud splat as it hits the door, sending pieces of apple flying everywhere. Nice.
c-9: ^As the door burns, you begin to question your choice of setting fire to the only way out ot the cabin.
^Luckily for you, a hole burns in the door before the rest of the cabin can catch on fire.
^You quietly think to yourself, that a more destructive fire spell could have been a catastrophic choice.

b: ^ Lucky for you, you've grown accustomed to this kind of work, and the lock pops open in no time.
^ It takes a few attempts, and as you're about to give up, the lock finally clicks open.

c-12: ^You slam the frying pan on the handle, and it pops off exactly as planned, though the impact leaves your hand slightly sore.
c-13: ^Now decorated with 24 shallow "stab wounds", the door doesn't budge. Damnit.

s0: ^You slam the staff on the handle, and it pops off exactly as planned, though the impact reverberates through the staff into your hands. You try to shake off the nasty feeling.
s1: ^You slam the staff at the handle, but it glances off the side, redirecting your strike into the floor. The impact sends terrible reverberations through your entire arms, leaving you reeling.

c-15: ^The bottle shatters against the door, sending glass flying everywhere!
^As the glass shards settle, the potion splatter on the door drips onto the floor. It was an attempt to be certain.

b: ^You wince as a small amount of blood spills from your finger. Time to call it quits for now.
^ and you feel reaffirmed of your
^After your hands feel normal again, you poke the door open with the staff.
^As you give the cabin a hasty final once-over, you notice some cards on the table.
^You have no idea how you missed these before, and you quickly pocket them.
^You give the cabin another glance in hopes of finding something else you may have missed, but nothing turns up.
^You quickly scour through the cabin again, hoping to find some cards again, but nothing turns up.
^You hop out of the cabin through the hole in the door,
^ making sure to have your host body hold on to you on the way.
^ taking in the fresh air as you go.
^You step out of the cabin, taking in the beautiful nature view around you. Adventure awaits!
^You exit the cabin, bracing yourself for the coming adventure.
